alert.note: Alert for Brown; Clermont; Warren (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 03 at 5:30PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTHEASTERN CLERMONT, NORTHWESTERN BROWN AND SOUTHEASTERN WARREN COUNTIES THROUGH 600 PM EDT... At 530 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located near Blanchester, moving southwest at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph, pea size hail, frequent cloud-to-ground lightning, and very heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Lightning can cause serious injury or death. Visibility will be poor and hydroplaning is possible. Locations impacted include... Woodville, Owensville, Goshen, Newtonsville, Butlerville, Pleasant Plain, State Route 123 at State Route 132, Springvale, Edenton, Lake Lorelei, Mount Repose and Day Heights. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Motorists should slow down and use extra caution. When thunder roars, go indoors! Do not stay in the open or seek shelter under trees when lightning threatens. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
